title: ISic000527. I.Sicily inscription 000527
body:
Facsimile Images

Diis Manibus
P(ublius) ((·)) Stationam [--- Sta-]
tius [Qu]artus ((·)) et [((·)) sibi]
et ((·)) Salviae ((·)) C(ai) ((·)) f(iliae) ((·)) Feliculae [((·))] uxori
5posterisque suis ((·)) l(ocus) [((·)) d(atus) ((·)) d(ecreto) ((·)) d(ecurionum)]

Apparatus criticus

Text: CIL; Gualtherus only reports P.SIA...R...MARIO ... STA
line.3: Gulatherus only reports -TIUS.A...TUS.ET.SIBI

English translation

To the shades of the underworld. Publius Stationam[...? ...] Statius Quartus [set this up] for himself, for his wife Salvia Felicula, daughter of Caius, and for his children. The place for it was given by the decree of the decurions

commentary

bibliography

    10.7247 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
